Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council Rules and Section 197-d (b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Review Procedure Application nos. INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign A.4793/S.1930, legislation excluding Social Security payments and supplemental Social Security income from the definition of "income" for the purposes of determining eligibility under the senior citizen rent increase exemption (SCRIE) program.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Aging
Items.MatterName: Excluding Social Security payments and supplemental Social Security income from the definition of "income" for the purposes of determining eligibility under the SCRIE program. (A.4793/S.1930)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Unified Court System to require the Integrated Domestic Violence Courts in New York City to issue regular reports on batterer intervention programs.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Women's Issues
Items.MatterName: Require the Integrated Domestic Violence Courts in NYC to issue regular reports on batterer intervention programs.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Bronx District Attorney’s Office to alter its prosecution policy for domestic violence cases.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Women's Issues
Items.MatterName: Bronx DA’s Office to alter its prosecution policy for domestic violence cases.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State legislature to pass and the Governor to sign legislation to modify the existing reporting requirements for the Statewide Central Register of Child Abuse and Maltreatment and require identifying information when making a report of child abuse.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Modify the existing reporting requirements for the Statewide Central Register of Child Abuse and Maltreatment and require identifying information when making a report of child abuse.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign S.7851, the Survivor’s Accessing Fair and Equitable Housing Act.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Housing
Items.MatterName: Survivor’s Accessing Fair and Equitable Housing Act. (S.7851)

Items.Title: Resolution urging the United States Congress to restore full funding to the New York City Housing Authority’s Section 8 Leased Housing Program.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Housing
Items.MatterName: Restore full funding to the New York City Housing Authority’s Section 8 Leased Housing Program.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Assembly to pass and the Governor to sign the Michael Sandy Act, which limits the admissibility of evidence of a defendant and victim falling under the same protected category in hate crime cases.

Items.MatterName: Michael Sandy Act
